column4: I got connected with internet on the pc with grub problem... can you tell me what to do again please
Here is the pastebin of the Grub menu problem. Hope you have time to have a look http://paste.stgraber.org/1717
you have xp pro on the second partition?
The only thing I know that it worked fine a month ago:-)
What is the exact problem...  please write it all on oneline

The problem is the grub menu loadss, whern it loads I cant choose options. Like if I want to boot on ubuntu or windows. The marker don't move when I hit th arrow keys. I do not know if it has the same problem, but when I try to access the win disk from ubuntu I get this error: hal-storage-fixed-mount-all-options refused uid 1000
interesting..  so the options are correct, it just wont let you chose any of them

Yes that's correct. First the menu did not show when hitting escape, then I edited it to show menu as default. Now I cant move the marker. And I'm sure it's not the keyboard. All the keys work in f.eks bios. And the grub menu was fine a month ago
are you in ubuntu on the same computer?
Yes. And I think thats may be the same problem
not the same problem, but mabe thats because I can' access win in grub
Here is the fstab if you wan't to have a look. The win disk does not mount http://pastebin.org/24442
sudo mkdir /media/locked-drive then sudo mount -t ntfs-3g /dev/sda1 /media/locked-drive -o force  substitute your locked drive for sda1
Force Mount a Drive  http://forum.notebookreview.com/archive/index.php/t-211958.html
I may be doing it wrong, but I did not get it to work
You must have serious issues on that drive
here is the error: Failed to mount '/dev/sda1': Invalid argument
is this what you typed into a term  sudo mount -t ntfs-3g /dev/sda1 /media/locked-drive -o force
You should read the last entry on that page I linked.. it may help
is this what you typed into a term  sudo mount -t ntfs-3g /dev/sda1 /media/locked-drive -o force
You should read the last entry on that page I linked.. it may help
